intro: Lotononis pusilla, commonly known as the small lotonon, is a small, herbaceous annual plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and features narrow, linear leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom from late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassy or rocky areas. Due to its compact size and ornamental flowers, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
